abstracts.cdata!:
The Sixth Caribbean Development Bank
            Project's objectives are to: (a) channel the loan funds
            to eligible Bank/Caribbean Development Bank (CDB) member
            countries in the Commonwealth Caribbean; (b) enhance the
            amount and scope of development and financial services
            offered to common Bank/CDB borrowing member countries; and
            (c) help CDB implement the agreed sectoral and institutional
            strategies. The loan proceeds will be relent by CDB in
            support of private as well as public sector projects and
            will be available for lending for investment and permanent
            working capital or for technical assistance. The eligible
            sectors will be those sectors on which CDB has issued
            lending strategy papers acceptable to the Bank. These
            sectors include: agriculture, industry tourism,
            infrastructure (transportation, water and sewerage, and
            power), indirect lending through other financial
            institutions for onlending to the private sector, and human
            resource development.
